intro: Isodictyophorus chevalieri, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are velvety to the touch, giving it its common name. The plant produces clusters of small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are capsule-like structures containing numerous seeds. Isodictyophorus chevalieri is often found in disturbed habitats and can become invasive in certain regions.
